channel.title: I think i gots a trojan =(
channel.description:
Well, i downloaded something, then when i ran it, my mouse was appearing in different spots on my screen randomly.... Then i booted it down and when i turned it back on, it asked me for a password, i never had one set, so my dad went in through safe mode, got on the administrative account and removed the password. Now i can get back on but i still believe im infected and it may still be doing damage to my computer, help?
also, please recommend and or link me to a virus scanner.

item.title: I think i gots a trojan =(
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Moparisthebest:

^That link doesn’t exactly look too trustworthy, if you are going to stick with windows I would stick with adaware.

As well as spybot search and destroy.

Generally, a rule of thumb is, if it matches any of the following criteria, then don’t even bother with it.

Does it have it’s own website?
Do you need to “buy it” to get rid of something?
Does it always find viruses?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Frell:

Is it free? Is it installed? And is they’re any problems running rs or other java apps with it? And would i lose all of my files by switching?

Yes it is free, you can install it beside windows if you want and therefore lose 0 files, and Java apps and RS run even better under linux than windows.

item.title: I think i gots a trojan =(
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

I wouldn’t consider Kubuntu to be a program but you know

Also, *unix can get viruses:

Gizmodo

Plug-'n'-Play USB Virus Makes MacBooks Fall to Pieces

Behold, a video of the Newton Virus. Back in 2005, Troika, the British-based art collective that was behind the Heathrow Terminal 5 sculpture that some of you recently described as a "disco turd," created a virus for Macs, called Newton. It...

Apparently.

Read full topic

I can’t really find viruses.

item.title: I think i gots a trojan =(
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

You have quite a few nasty bits of spyware/adware. No apparent keyloggers or viruses. I’d recommend doing a scan with Adaware (free) maybe spybot search and destroy.

And any up-to-date antivirus software you may have, if you don’t have any just try AVG free or something.

Probably not needed, but better safe than sorry.

Read full topic

item.source: I think i gots a trojan =(

item.title: I think i gots a trojan =(
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Well, i downloaded something, then when i ran it, my mouse was appearing in different spots on my screen randomly… Then i booted it down and when i turned it back on, it asked me for a password, i never had one set, so my dad went in through safe mode, got on the administrative account and removed the password. Now i can get back on but i still believe im infected and it may still be doing damage to my computer, help?

also, please recommend and or link me to a virus scanner.

Read full topic
item.source: I think i gots a trojan =(
